description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4m1n2","text":"This process instruction describes steps for whole genome amplicon sequencing of SARS-CoV-2 from wastewater, including two approaches for concentration and RNA extraction steps (using liquid wastewater, or wastewater solids), purification steps, reverse transcription and PCR with ARTIC primers, library construction, and Illumina sequencing. Sequencing data produced using this protocol may be used for a variety of analyses including estimation of variant and mutation abundance. The read lengths are sufficient for read merging and analysis of intact amplicons. This protocol has been used for sequencing activities as part of the WastewaterSCAN program.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Option 2: Viral particle concentration and RNA extraction from LIQUID wastewater
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ndr4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64nu5","text":"Spin down 50 mL of influent at 5,250 xg for 5 min to clarify the influent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Option 2: Viral particle concentration and RNA extraction from LIQUID wastewater
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"67pig","text":"Add 4.875 mL of influent sample to one well (one well per sample) of a new KingFisher 24 Well Deep Well Plate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Option 2: Viral particle concentration and RNA extraction from LIQUID wastewater
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"csl10","text":"Add another 4.875 mL of influent sample to the same well location on a second KingFisher 24 Well Deep Well Plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Option 2: Viral particle concentration and RNA extraction from LIQUID wastewater
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dt3gf","text":"Add 50 µL of Nanotrap Enhancement Reagent 1 (ER1) Solution to each well used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Option 2: Viral particle concentration and RNA extraction from LIQUID wastewater
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6majt","text":"Add 75 µL of Nanotrap Microbiome A Particles to each well used on the two KingFisher 24 Well Deep Well sample plates. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Option 2: Viral particle concentration and RNA extraction from LIQUID wastewater
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2mihl","text":"Prepare the “Lysis Plate”: Add 350 µL of MagMAX Microbiome Lysis Solution to each well of a new KingFisher 24 Well Deep Well Plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Option 2: Viral particle concentration and RNA extraction from LIQUID wastewater
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6lh5l","text":"Run KF-008-WW-Nanotrap-24.bdz on the King Fisher Flex to concentrate the viral particles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Option 2: Viral particle concentration and RNA extraction from LIQUID wastewater
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8q75k","text":"Once the protocol is completed, the “Lysis Plate” will contain ~350 µL lysate that is ready to proceed to nucleic acid extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Option 2: Viral particle concentration and RNA extraction from LIQUID wastewater
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fv82c","text":"Transfer 300 µL of lysate to each well of the Chemagic Deepwell Plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5g9ue","text":"Add 300 µL of Lysis Buffer to each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"adfie","text":"Place the plate on a magnet to capture the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6fq5c","text":"Incubate until the liquid is clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d41o3","text":"Carefully remove and discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c4cve","text":"Keeping the plate on the magnet, add 200 µL of 80% ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4flb8","text":"Incubate the plate on the magnet at room temperature for 30 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ah1ag","text":"Carefully remove and discard the ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ch6ci","text":"Keeping the plate on the magnet, add 200 µL of 80% ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21mso","text":"Incubate the plate on the magnet at room temperature for 30 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6900p","text":"Carefully remove and discard the ethanol. Try to remove all residual ethanol without disturbing the beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bo6gl","text":"Dry the beads at room temperature for 3-5 minutes, or until all of the ethanol has evaporated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"574dm","text":"Remove the plate from the magnet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e0m1","text":"Resuspend the beads in 27 µL of elution buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"67p5s","text":"Incubate the plate at room temperature for 2 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ettl4","text":"Place the plate on a magnet to capture the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"95aqh","text":"Incubate until the liquid is clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ttv5","text":"Transfer the 25 µL of clear supernatant to a new plate. Libraries are ready for pooling and sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c12h3","text":"Measure the library concentration by qPCR using the KAPA Illumina Library Quantification kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4238i","text":"Pool samples, aiming for equimolar amounts of each. Negative control libraries may not yield enough material to be pooled in the same quantity as actual samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4g2r0","text":"Sequence the pool on an Illumina system using a kit that will yield ≥250PE reads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
